pygenderbr package¶

Submodules¶

pygenderbr.genderbrapitool module¶

Module Class that interface with “Nomes” IBGE API

class pygenderbr.genderbrapitool.Gender¶

Bases: object

Class tool that run requests on ‘Nomes’ IBGE API

Methods
getgender() getgenderocurrence() getocurrence() getranking()
getgender(name, threshold=0.9)¶

Get the name(s) gender from the IBGE census database, based on a threshold value that represent the minimim limit of percent ocurrence of name(s) to it be on a specific gender. Returns a dataframe resume with name(s) gender (‘F’ or ‘M’).

Parameters:
  • name – string ou string list with name(s) to get ocurrence.
  • threshold – minimum percent value that represent a limit of gender.
Returns:

dataframe with name(s) gender (‘F’ or ‘M’)
getgenderocurrence(name, locale=None)¶

Get the name(s) ocurrence(s) from the IBGE census database. Returns a dataframe resume with number of times that name(s) occurs per gender.

Parameters:
  • name – string ou string list with name(s) to get ocurrence.
  • locale – specify locale (state abrev) to get the name(s) ocurrence(s).
Returns:

dataframe with name(s) occurence(s) per gender
getocurrence(name, gender=None, locale=None)¶

Get the name(s) ocurrence(s) from the IBGE census database. Returns a dataframe with number of times that name(s) occurs.

Parameters:
  • name – string ou string list with name(s) to get ocurrence.
  • gender – specify gender to get the name(s) ocurrence(s).
  • locale – specify locale (state abrev) to get the name(s) ocurrence(s).
Returns:

dataframe with name(s) occurence(s)
getranking(gender=None, decade=None, locale=None)¶

Get the names ranking with 20’s most used names on Brazil or state. The ranking would be on specific gender or specific decade (between 1900 and 2010).

Parameters:
  • gender – specify gender to get the names ranking.
  • decade – specify decade to get the names ranking.
  • locale – specify locale (state abrev) to get the names ranking.
Returns:

dataframe with name(s) ranking
